page.title: 18The Village of Swepstone
page.content: The village of Swepstone has remained roughly the same size over the years. As old cottages were pulled down, council houses, flats and bungalows have replaced them, since the Council have said village size is to remain in proportion. Thus only infilling has been allowed, houses being built in between existing houses and not in new areas. The community has changed from a farming to a middle-class one, the inhabitants being made up of retired locals and small farm holders, and also newcomers like doctors, solicitors and businessmen. The village has one bus stop, phone box and post box. The old school is now used as a social meeting-place for clubs like the Guides, Mothers and Toddlers, the Welcome Club and the Mothers' Union.
